name: The Catholic Health Association Of India
briefDescription: Founded in 1943 by Sr. Dr Mary Glowrey, an Australian Nun, CHAI is one of the world's largest not-for-profit healthcare networks with a membership base of 3522 Member Institutions (MIs) as on date – 80% serve in the medically underserved areas. CHAI MIs extend medical care to over 21 million persons in a year, mostly the marginalized - with a team of 1000 Sister-Doctors; 25,000 Sister-Nurses; 10,000 plus Sister-paraprofessionals and around 5,000 Sister Social Workers, along with a huge number of lay employees. CHAI MIs are engaged in maternal and child health; prevention and control of communicable and NCDs, such as, HIV/AIDS, TB, malaria, diabetes, etc.; positive health promotion; holistic care for PLHIVs, terminally ill and elderly, etc.​
